notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end.
Shelomoh Scanriani and Mosheh Refa’el Scanriani, inscribed with names on folio 227v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Parts of the Hagiographa, provided with vowel-points and accents, with marginal notes regarding ḳeri.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each. The quires are marked with catchwords on the lower left-hand corner of the last page and numbered with Hebrew letters both at the beginning and at the end of the quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square script, punctuated, of the 15th century. Natan Casallo, inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 136v.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860); his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (131-153: inscribed (folio [249v]).
